intro: Nasturtium amphibium var. pinnatifidum, commonly known as the broadleaf watercress, is a semi-aquatic plant native to wetland environments. It features heart-shaped, pinnately divided leaves that are often submerged or floating on the water surface. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
